ClassDecl.Name: GuiControl
ClassDecl.Document: <Document> <summary> The base class of all controls. When the control is destroyed, it automatically destroys sub controls, and the bounds composition from the style controller. If you want to manually destroy a control, you should first remove it from its parent. The only way to remove a control from a parent control, is to remove the bounds composition from its parent composition. The same to inserting a control. </summary> </Document>

ClassDecl.Name: IStyleController
ClassDecl.Document: <Document> <summary> Represents a style for a control. A style is something like a skin, but contains some default action handlers. </summary> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetBoundsComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the bounds composition. A bounds composition represents all visible contents of a control.</summary> <returns>The bounds composition.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetContainerComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the container composition. A container composition is where to place all bounds compositions for child controls.</summary> <returns>The container composition.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetFocusableComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the focusable composition. A focusable composition is the composition to be focused when the control is focused.</summary> <param name="value">The focusable composition.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetText
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the text to display on the control.</summary> <param name="value">The text to display.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetFont
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the font to render the text.</summary> <param name="value">The font to render the text.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetVisuallyEnabled
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the enableing state to affect the rendering of the control.</summary> <param name="value">The enableing state.</param> </Document>

ClassDecl.Name: IStyleProvider
ClassDecl.Document: <Document> <summary> A style provider is a callback interface for some control that already provides a style controller, but the controller need callbacks to create sub compositions or handle actions. </summary> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: AssociateStyleController
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Called when a style provider is associated with a style controller.</summary> <param name="controller">The style controller that is associated.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetFocusableComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the focusable composition. A focusable composition is the composition to be focused when the control is focused.</summary> <param name="value">The focusable composition.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetText
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the text to display on the control.</summary> <param name="value">The text to display.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetFont
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the font to render the text.</summary> <param name="value">The font to render the text.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetVisuallyEnabled
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the enableing state to affect the rendering of the control.</summary> <param name="value">The enableing state.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GuiControl
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Create a control with a specified style controller.</summary> <param name="_styleController">The style controller.</param> </Document>

VarDecl.Name: VisibleChanged
VarDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Visible event. This event will be raised when the visibility state of the control is changed.</summary> </Document>

VarDecl.Name: EnabledChanged
VarDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Enabled event. This event will be raised when the enabling state of the control is changed.</summary> </Document>

VarDecl.Name: VisuallyEnabledChanged
VarDecl.Document: <Document> <summary> Enabled event. This event will be raised when the visually enabling state of the control is changed. A visually enabling is combined by the enabling state and the parent's visually enabling state. A control is rendered as disabled, not only when the control itself is disabled, but also when the parent control is rendered as disabled. </summary> </Document>

VarDecl.Name: AltChanged
VarDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Alt changed event. This event will be raised when the associated Alt-combined shortcut key of the control is changed.</summary> </Document>

VarDecl.Name: TextChanged
VarDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Text changed event. This event will be raised when the text of the control is changed.</summary> </Document>

VarDecl.Name: FontChanged
VarDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Font changed event. This event will be raised when the font of the control is changed.</summary> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetNotifyEventArguments
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>A function to create the argument for notify events that raised by itself.</summary> <returns>The created argument.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetStyleController
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the associated style controller.</summary> <returns>The associated style controller.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetBoundsComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the bounds composition for the control. The value is from <links><link cref="::vl::presentation::controls::GuiControl::IStyleController::GetBoundsComposition()@s:vl.presentation.controls.GuiControl" /></links>.</summary> <returns>The bounds composition.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetContainerComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the container composition for the control. The value is from <links><link cref="::vl::presentation::controls::GuiControl::IStyleController::GetContainerComposition()@s:vl.presentation.controls.GuiControl" /></links>.</summary> <returns>The container composition.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetFocusableComposition
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the focusable composition for the control. A focusable composition is the composition to be focused when the control is focused.</summary> <returns>The focusable composition.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetEventReceiver
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the event receiver from the bounds composition.</summary> <returns>The event receiver.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetParent
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the parent control.</summary> <returns>The parent control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetChildrenCount
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the number of child controls.</summary> <returns>The number of child controls.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetChild
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the child control using a specified index.</summary> <returns>The child control.</returns> <param name="index">The specified index.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: AddChild
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Put another control in the container composition of this control.</summary> <returns>Returns true if this operation succeeded.</returns> <param name="control">The control to put in this control.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: HasChild
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Test if a control owned by this control.</summary> <returns>Returns true if the control is owned by this control.</returns> <param name="control">The control to test.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetRelatedControlHost
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the <links><link cref="::vl::presentation::controls::GuiControlHost@s:vl.presentation.controls.GuiControlHost" /></links> that contains this control.</summary> <returns>The <links><link cref="::vl::presentation::controls::GuiControlHost@s:vl.presentation.controls.GuiControlHost" /></links> that contains this control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetVisuallyEnabled
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Test if this control is rendered as enabled.</summary> <returns>Returns true if this control is rendered as enabled.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetEnabled
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Test if this control is enabled.</summary> <returns>Returns true if this control is enabled.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetEnabled
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Make the control enabled or disabled.</summary> <param name="value">Set to true to make the control enabled.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetVisible
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Test if this visible or invisible.</summary> <returns>Returns true if this control is visible.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetVisible
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Make the control visible or invisible.</summary> <param name="value">Set to true to make the visible enabled.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetAlt
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the Alt-combined shortcut key associated with this control.</summary> <returns>The Alt-combined shortcut key associated with this control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetAlt
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Associate a Alt-combined shortcut key with this control.</summary> <returns>Returns true if this operation succeeded.</returns> <param name="value">The Alt-combined shortcut key to associate. Only zero, sigle or multiple upper case letters are legal.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetActivatingAltHost
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Make the control as the parent of multiple Alt-combined shortcut key activatable controls.</summary> <param name="host">The alt action host object.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetText
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the text to display on the control.</summary> <returns>The text to display on the control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetText
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the text to display on the control.</summary> <param name="value">The text to display on the control.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetFont
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the font to render the text.</summary> <returns>The font to render the text.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetFont
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the font to render the text.</summary> <param name="value">The font to render the text.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetFocus
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Focus this control.</summary> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetTag
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the tag object of the control.</summary> <returns>The tag object of the control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetTag
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the tag object of the control.</summary> <param name="value">The tag object of the control.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetTooltipControl
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the tooltip control of the control.</summary> <returns>The tooltip control of the control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetTooltipControl
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the tooltip control of the control. The tooltip control will be released when this control is released. If you set a new tooltip control to replace the old one, the old one will not be owned by this control anymore, therefore user should release the old tooltip control manually.</summary> <returns>The old tooltip control.</returns> <param name="value">The tooltip control of the control.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: GetTooltipWidth
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Get the tooltip width of the control.</summary> <returns>The tooltip width of the control.</returns> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: SetTooltipWidth
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Set the tooltip width of the control.</summary> <param name="value">The tooltip width of the control.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: DisplayTooltip
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Display the tooltip.</summary> <returns>Returns true if this operation succeeded.</returns> <param name="location">The relative location to specify the left-top position of the tooltip.</param> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: CloseTooltip
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Close the tooltip that owned by this control.</summary> </Document>

FuncDecl.Name: QueryService
FuncDecl.Document: <Document> <summary>Query a service using an identifier. If you want to get a service of type IXXX, use IXXX::Identifier as the identifier.</summary> <returns>The requested service. If the control doesn't support this service, it will be null.</returns> <param name="identifier">The identifier.</param> </Document>
